JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Laboratory Technician for Lab Management, Teaching, and Research
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you like a dynamic work environment with varying tasks that provide opportunities for professional as well as personal development?

The Department of Biotechnology and Biomedicine (DTU Bioengineering) is looking for an independent and enthusiastic laboratory technician with a flair for coordination and problem-solving for employment in the Section for Protein Science and Biotherapeutics (PSBT).

Primary responsibilities
Your primary responsibilities will involve laboratory management, procurement and purchasing of chemicals and reagents, coordination of teaching activities for practical laboratory courses, and research support. Your tasks will include maintenance of laboratories and equipment, training of students and new users, coordination and preparation for experimental courses, student and trainee supervision, and experimental work on different research projects.

You will be part of the section's technician team (consisting of ten technicians and trainees and a team leader). As part of the technician team, you support the section's diverse research and teaching activities, which span a range of topics and methods within biochemistry, molecular biology, and cell biology.

Your background and qualifications
Besides have an education as laboratory technician we expect that you are a trained laboratory technician and see yourself as a generalist, who has experience with:
  • biochemical, molecular biological, and/or cell biological methods, for example protein production, affinity chromatography, mass spectrometry-based techniques, PCR-based methods, molecular cloning, ELISAs, mammalian cell culture, or related methods and techniques
  • supervision and instruction of students or trainees
  • experience with laboratory or infrastructure management

Importantly, you have a can-do attitude and are a problem-solver who loves a challenge and thrives with coordination of multiple tasks. You are self-led and self-motivated, you can handle tasks independently, and you like engaging with a range of people and professions to produce the best possible teaching and research.

At DTU Bioengineering you will have many international colleagues. We therefore also expect that you are confident communicating in English, both verbally and in writing.

We offer
DTU Bioengineering offers a flexible and dynamic work environment with good opportunities to develop both professionally and personally through the teaching and research activities.

You will work in a highly international environment and in collaboration with other employees be able to pursue novel workflows and methods in an ever-developing field biotechnology and biomedicine. You will be involved in a wide range of coordination tasks, which ensure that the section's teaching activities and cutting-edge research projects run smoothly perform to the highest standards.

DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.

Salary and terms of employment
Salary and employment conditions is based on the OAO-S joint agreement and association agreement for office workers, laboratory technicians and IT staff (HK/Stat) signed with the Danish Ministry of Finance.

The position is full time, but a part-time employment can be negotiated.

Start date: 1st of July 2022 or as soon as possible thereafter.

Application and contact
Please submit your online application no later than 1 June 2022. Open the 'Apply online' link, fill in the form and attach a cover letter outlining your motivation for the application, your CV, and your diplomas and references.

If you would like more information about the position, please contact, Lab Manager Lene Holberg Blicher by email (lench@dtu.dk) or phone (+45 45258610).

You can read more about the Department at www.bioengineering.dtu.dk

All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.

Department of Biotechnology and Biomedicine (DTU Bioengineering) is an international leader in biotechnology and biomedicine. Our engineering approach to all aspects of biotechnology and biomedicine positions us as a valuable player with unique competences in a growing bio-based economy and with health systems transforming towards personalized medicine. We have a clear focus on the needs in the life science industry and point towards innovation, new businesses and scientific services for the benefit of society. The department has extensive collaborations with national and international research units and industry. DTU Bioengineering has approx. 300 employees, of which 2/3 is scientific staff. The department is located at DTU Lyngby Campus.

Technology for people
DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear vision to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That vision lives on today. DTU has 13,400 students and 5,800 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world.
